Module Contents

django.core.management.utils.popen_wrapper(args, stdout_encoding='utf-8')[source]

Friendly wrapper around Popen.

Return stdout output, stderr output, and OS status code.

django.core.management.utils.handle_extensions(extensions)[source]

Organize multiple extensions that are separated with commas or passed by using –extension/-e multiple times.

For example: running ‘django-admin makemessages -e js,txt -e xhtml -a’ would result in an extension list: [‘.js’, ‘.txt’, ‘.xhtml’]

>>> handle_extensions(['.html', 'html,js,py,py,py,.py', 'py,.py'])
{'.html', '.js', '.py'}
>>> handle_extensions(['.html, txt,.tpl'])
{'.html', '.tpl', '.txt'}
django.core.management.utils.find_command(cmd, path=None, pathext=None)[source]
django.core.management.utils.get_random_secret_key()[source]

Return a 50 character random string usable as a SECRET_KEY setting value.

django.core.management.utils.parse_apps_and_model_labels(labels)[source]

Parse a list of “app_label.ModelName” or “app_label” strings into actual objects and return a two-element tuple:

(set of model classes, set of app_configs).

Raise a CommandError if some specified models or apps don’t exist.

django.core.management.utils.get_command_line_option(argv, option)[source]

Return the value of a command line option (which should include leading dashes, e.g. ‘–testrunner’) from an argument list. Return None if the option wasn’t passed or if the argument list couldn’t be parsed.

django.core.management.utils.normalize_path_patterns(patterns)[source]

Normalize an iterable of glob style patterns based on OS.

django.core.management.utils.is_ignored_path(path, ignore_patterns)[source]

Check if the given path should be ignored or not based on matching one of the glob style ignore_patterns.

django.core.management.utils.find_formatters()[source]
django.core.management.utils.run_formatters(written_files, black_path=sentinel := object())[source]

Run the black formatter on the specified files.
